alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jefferson Davis; Lawrence; Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 6:14PM CDT until March 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Simpson County in central Mississippi... Lawrence County in south central Mississippi... Northwestern Covington County in southeastern Mississippi... Jefferson Davis County in south central Mississippi... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 613 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pinola to near Hebron to near Topeka, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Pinola and Shivers around 620 PM CDT. Sanatorium around 630 PM CDT. Magee around 635 PM CDT. Clem and Progress around 640 PM CDT. Prentiss, Society Hill and Lone Star around 645 PM CDT. Mount Olive and Carson around 655 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include New Hebron and Silver Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central, central and southeastern Mississippi. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
